title: Champion Reveal: Kindred, the Eternal Hunters

To anyone that thinks the ult is OP, bear in mind that it also HEALS and makes the ENEMY team invincible.

Although he's a marksman suited for jungle, I wonder how the passive will work in lane. If Kindred was used as an ADC and does well in lane after marking his lane opponents, he will be gaining stacks like crazy. Add that to passively marking the bottom river scuttle crab and the snowball potential becomes so real.
I don't think Kindred are necessarily a 'he' ..

well actually 
Active: Wolf temporarily splits from Lamb, creating a large spirit zone around him and attacking whoever Lamb attacks, or his closest enemy. Lamb can cast Dance of Arrows with a greatly reduced cooldown while inside Wolf's Frenzy.


on his W it states it as a "he".
"Him" refers to Wolf not Kindred... baka
Kindred is the name of the both of them. One is wolf and the shooter is the lamb
to be honest, it does not necessary has sex as it is not even human
Isn't kindred meant to be death who has split itself into two so it won't be so alone. Which is why wolf sounds male and lamb female because it is both genders like "God" is neither gender but both

kindred is both of them, Wolf is the flying one and Lamb is the white one, Wolf is guy Lamb is girl

Although he's*
after marking her lane opponents, they'll be gaining stacks like crazy*
Lamb marks enemy champions, Wolf marks jungle monsters, so obviously you should change the pronoun depending on which part of the passive you're talking about.

Otherwise, 'he' is the default pronoun, or 'they'

The big problem with running kindred adc seems to be that the passive wouldn't be useful. Maybe like an ultra niche tele heal combo with Braum or Janna for peel would work if your entire team committed to gettting Kindred fed.

Perhaps if they went Kindred adc and {{champion:223}} sup? He can help teleport them around to get the target, though it'd still require help from others for pinning and such as well as {{champion:223}}'s ult having limited range (Still might work).
it says that lamb can choose who to mark he can mark anyone he wants anywhere on the map
this guy makes a solid point on the champions abilities and were all here talking about its sexual orientation
I can't believe {{champion:429}}  isn't a counter. I mean R all he/she/it/they/whatever want. Dear sweet lady of vengeance will just happily stack her w and butthurt you when the R is done.

Is it just me or is this champion design kind of ghibli-esque? I mean that's far from a bad thing, I'm a huge fan of the ghibli style.  The kit looks like it'll be pretty fun to use as well.  Definitely going to be picking this one up.

I'm pretty sure whoever is making the new champions is going through a Studio Ghibli phase, specifically relating to the Princess Mononoke anime movie.

I mean come on the masks for Bard and Kindred, the meeps, the wolf, the lamb archerer, spiritual realms. It's all too coincidental

"O Wolf, Curse this thy foe with a mark, that with it thou mayst blow thine enemies to tiny bits, in thy mercy."
"First shalt thou take out the Holy Arrow. Then shalt thou count to three auto attacks, no more, no less. Three shall be the number of arrows thou shalt shoot, and the number of the shooting shall be three. Four shalt thou not shoot, neither shoot thou two, excepting that thou then proceed to three. Five is right out. Once the number three, being the third number, be reached, then lobbest thou thy Unholy Wolf of Antioch towards thy foe, who, being naughty in My sight, shall snuff it."
See, 3's the only number of stacks that makes sense. - FeelNFine NA region.... #stolenbutreferenced
